{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Rhenock | other_name = | nickname = | settlement_type = city | image_skyline = Viswa vinayaka.jpg | image_alt = | image_caption = [[Shri Viswa Vinayaka Mandir Rhenock|Viswa Vinayak]] temple at Rhenock | pushpin_map = India Sikkim#India | pushpin_label_position = left | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Sikkim, India | coordinates = {{coord|27.17|N|88.64|E|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} | subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Sikkim]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of districts of India|District]] | subdivision_name2 = East Sikkim | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | named_for = | government_type = | governing_body = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_total_km2 = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 1040 | population_total = | population_as_of = | population_rank = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_footnotes = | demographics_type1 = Languages | demographics1_title1 = Official | demographics1_info1 = [[Nepali language|Nepali]] (Gorkha), [[Bhutia language|Bhutia]], [[Lepcha language|Lepcha]], [[Limbu language|Limbu]], [[Newari language|Newari]], [[Kiranti languages|Rai]], [[Gurung language|Gurung]], Mangar, [[Sherpa language|Sherpa]], [[Tamang language|Tamang]] and [[Sunwar language|Sunwar]] | timezone1 = [[Indian Standard Time|IST]] | utc_offset1 = +5:30 | postal_code_type = [[Postal Index Number|PIN]] | postal_code = 737 133 | area_code_type = Telephone code | area_code = 03592 | registration_plate =SK | website = | footnotes = }} '''Rhenock''' is a small town in the east district in the [[Indian state]] of [[Sikkim]], located at {{Coord|27.176622|N|88.6432|E|}}. It lies 63 kilometres east of [[Gangtok]] on the way to [[Jelepla Pass]] at an altitude of 1,040 metres.{{cite web |url=http://www.india9.com/i9show/Rhenock-64404.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-11-13 |url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606070604/http://www.india9.com/i9show/Rhenock-64404.htm |archivedate=2011-06-06 |df= }} The word Rhe-nock (in [[Lepcha language|Lepcha]] dialect) means Black Hill. Situated in the extreme east of Sikkim, Rhenock witnessed the establishment of the first police outpost in the state, which is the historical event. {{cite web |url=http://sikkimpolice.nic.in/Files/History.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-06-28 |url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721174139/http://sikkimpolice.nic.in/Files/History.htm |archivedate=2011-07-21 |df= }} ==History== Rhenock was covered with dense forest in and around the 13th century. The [[Lepcha people|Lepchas]] were the early settlers about five or six hundred years ago. Middle of 16th century the [[Bhutia]]s, migrated from [[Tibet]] settled in the villages presently known as Kyongsa, Aritar, Tarpin, Reshi and Chalisey. The people who settled were Gorkha ethnic groups such as Newars, Bahuns (Adhikari, Poudyal, Gautam, Dahal, Bhandari, Pokhrel and Achaarja), Chhetri (Subedi, Khatiwada & Bista), Gurung, Rai and Limboo. Some people from Northern parts of India also migrated here at around 1940-1960 for business. ==People== '''Rhenock''' is inhabited by people of different ethnic groups such as [[Lepcha people|Lepchas]], [[Bhutia]]s, [[Demographics of Nepal|Nepali]]s ([[Gurkha|Gorkha]]s), [[Bihari people|Biharis]] and [[Marwaris]]. [[Lepcha people|Lepcha]] tribes who were early settlers have their own unique culture. Originally followers of [[Shamanism]], they later became followers of [[Buddhism]]. Some of them are followers of [[Christianity]]. [[Bhutia]]s are another group of tribes who are followers of [[Buddhism]] and who have their own identity and culture. The majority of the people are [[India]]n Nepalis also known as Gorkha. Most of them are [[Hindu]]s by religion. Some of the Nepalis [[Gurung]] after 1990 became [[Buddhist]]; before that they were followers of Hinduism. Some others are followers of [[Christianity]]. In spite of the above, everyone respects others' beliefs and faiths and celebrates others' festivals which makes a peaceful and prosperous [[society]]. ==Educational institutions== Rhenock has about 130 years of history of education. Rhenock School is among the oldest schools of Sikkim. It was established by a Christian missionary in 1880 at Rhenock (Khamdong).http://dietgangtok.nic.in/html/aboutus.html Later it was taken over by the government of Sikkim and shifted to Kingstone. Presently the school is known as Senior Secondary School, Rhenock. A Sanskrit Pathshala (School) was run in the premises of Rhenock [[Temple]] to teach Sanskrit and rituals to train [[Hindu]] priests. After the merger of Sikkim into the [[India]]n union more than a dozen schools were opened by the government of Sikkim. Rhenock now has the following educational institutions: * [[Government College Rhenock East Sikkim|Government Degree College]] * Government Senior Secondary School, Rhenock * Government Secondary School, Tarpin * Government Secondary School, Sudunglakha * Government Secondary School, Aritar * St. Joseph's School, Rhenock * Sanskrit School at Khamdong & Rhenock Bazar * Others: Junior high schools and many primary schools ==Places of interest== [[File:Lampokhari1.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Aritar Lake
